intro: Herrea alba, commonly known as the white hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white petals. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate with a rough texture, and it produces yellow stamens that surround a central pistil. Herrea alba thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
